profile_data.summary:
As a GIS data scientist, I am passionate about using data to create useful insights, and compelling stories. Using my expertise in big data, machine learning, and software programming, I enjoy solving challenging issues, identifying unusual trends in data, and developing ideas that will ultimately benefit my clients.
I have 5+ years of work experience in Data Mining, Big Data, Predictive Modelling and Optimization. My work experience as a GIS Data Scientist and researcher enabled me to gain expertise in both industrial and academic research.

★ Skills & Expertise: 
► Specialities: GIS tools (ArcGIS, QGIS), R, Python, SPSS, SAS, Tableau, Power BI, Excel (VBA)
► Extensive programming skills in SQL, Scala, BigQuery, Snowflake
► Highly Familiar with Hadoop ecosystem: Hive, Spark, MapReduce
► Proficient in Data Mining and Machine Learning algorithms such as Multivariate Time Series, Decision Trees, Linear & Logistic Regression, K-Means Clustering, Naïve Bayes and Neural Networks.
► Customer Segmentation, Social Networks Analysis, Sentiment Analysis
► Version Control: Git
► Soft Skills: Communication, Curiosity, Business mindset, Adaptability, Critical and Analytical thinking

☛ I can be reached either through this profile or by email at arfakhalid09@gmail.com

publications.name: Analyzing the Effectiveness of Covid-19 Vaccines among different Age Groups using Multinomial Logistic Regression Model
publications.description:
A predictive model was developed in R using a multinomial logistic regression analysis approach. The aim of this analysis was to forecast vaccine effectiveness in the Canadian province of Saskatchewan. By analyzing various factors that could impact vaccine efficacy, such as age, medical history, and vaccine type, the results indicate that a highly accurate model are developed that predicted vaccine effectiveness with a 95% accuracy rate.
Furthermore, the analysis revealed a noteworthy finding regarding the efficacy of vaccines in young people. Specifically, the model predicted that young people had a 70% higher ratio of vaccine efficacy compared to other age groups. This finding has important implications for public health officials in terms of targeting vaccine campaigns to specific age groups and minimizing the spread of infectious diseases.
Overall, the successful development of this predictive model using multinomial logistic regression analysis in R has significant potential for informing public health policy decisions related to vaccine efficacy and could ultimately improve vaccination rates and disease prevention efforts in Saskatchewan and beyond.
This thesis was submitted in partial fulfillment of the requirements for the Master of Science degree in Statistics.

volunteer.description:
As a member of the CSAS Society, I took part in organizing various events and activities within the department. I helped to plan and coordinate volunteer work opportunities, identifying local organizations and charities that could benefit from our support. Through my efforts, I encouraged fellow students to contribute their time and resources to important causes in the community.
Additionally, I played a crucial role in organizing the annual sports gala, collaborating with other society members to create a fun and competitive day-long event. I also helped to plan the departmental dinner, an annual formal gathering that brought together students, faculty, and staff to celebrate the achievements of the past year and provided opportunities to explore new places, learn about different cultures, and build new friendships.
Overall, my contributions to the CSAS Society's social activity committee were focused on creating a vibrant and inclusive community within our department.

member.occupation: PhD in Earth Systems and Geoinformation Sciences

projects.description:
The Climate Change Analysis project demonstrates the power of data science to unravel climate trends and inform climate action. It emphasizes the importance of data analysis and visualization in addressing complex environmental issues and contributing to a sustainable future.
- Data Acquisition and Exploration: Imported necessary libraries (Matplotlib, NumPy, Seaborn, scikit-learn) and loaded NASA's climate change dataset for 1951-1980.
- Exploratory Data Analysis: Employed scatter plots to visualize temperature trends over time.
- Linear Regression Modeling: Implemented linear regression models using NumPy and scikit-learn to identify and quantify temperature change patterns.
- Seaborn Visualization: Visualized a larger dataset covering 1882-2014 using Seaborn, plotting scatter points, and a regression line, and comparing actual and predicted temperature values.
- Climate Change Insights: Analyzed the results to gain valuable insights into historical and recent temperature trends, suggesting a potential acceleration in climate change.
- Comparison of Actual vs. Predicted Values: Assessed the accuracy of the regression models by comparing actual temperature values with predicted values.
projects.title: Climate Change Analysis: Time Series Forecasting in ML

member.occupation: PhD in Earth Systems and Geoinformation Sciences

projects.description:
- Leveraged data science expertise to develop a classification model predicting on-time flight arrivals with an accuracy of 86.43% and an ROC AUC score of 0.70.
- Data Preprocessing: Imported, cleaned, and prepared flight data for analysis using Pandas.
- Feature Engineering: Quantized numerical data and converted categorical variables into dummy variables.
- Model Selection and Training: Employed RandomForestClassifier algorithm for binary classification.
- Model Evaluation: Assessed model performance using mean accuracy, ROC AUC score, and confusion matrix.
- Model Improvement Recommendations: Proposed strategies for model enhancement, including algorithm exploration, parameter tuning, dataset expansion, and imbalance reduction.
- Visualization: Generated ROC curve to visualize model performance.
- Predictive Analytics: Developed a function to predict on-time arrival probabilities and demonstrated probability plots for various flight scenarios.
projects.title: Enhancing Air Travel Efficiency with Machine Learning-Powered Flight Delay Prediction

member.occupation: PhD in Earth Systems and Geoinformation Sciences

projects.description:
This project utilized the IMDB dataset, encompassing 50,000 movie reviews, and employed Keras, a popular deep-learning library, to construct and train a neural network model. Leveraged deep learning techniques (Natural Language Processing for unstructured text data) to develop a sentiment analysis model capable of classifying movie reviews as positive or negative.

- Data Preprocessing: Effectively handled data preprocessing tasks, including data loading, text conversion to integers, and padding to standardize review lengths.
- Neural Network Architecture: Designed and implemented a sequential deep learning model comprising an Embedding layer for word mapping, two Dense layers for feature learning, and a final layer with one neuron for sentiment prediction using sigmoid activation.
- Model Training and Evaluation: Optimized the model through training, achieving an accuracy of 86.97% on the test set. Monitored training and validation accuracy to prevent overfitting.
- Sentiment Analysis Function: Developed a reusable function to analyze sentiment in custom text inputs, demonstrating the model's versatility beyond movie reviews.
- Custom Input Testing: Successfully evaluated sentiment in various input texts, showcasing the model's adaptability and generalizability.
projects.title: Predicting Public Opinion with Deep Learning and Natural Language Processing

member.occupation: PhD in Earth Systems and Geoinformation Sciences

projects.description:
This project showcases my proficiency in SQL database management, advanced querying techniques, and descriptive statistics. It comprises several SQL scripts and a detailed README file, covering the following aspects:

- Advanced Querying with Bash Integration: This script demonstrates the ability to leverage the Bash shell within SQL queries, enabling efficient data extraction and manipulation.
-  Descriptive Statistics in PostgreSQL: This script focuses on performing descriptive statistics computations directly within PostgreSQL, providing valuable insights into data distribution and trends.
- Student Database Design and Management: These scripts showcase the creation and management of a student database, including table structure, relationships, and data manipulation using both standard SQL and Bash integration for advanced functionality.
-  Script Writing: This project effectively demonstrates my advanced SQL querying skills, proficiency in PostgreSQL for statistical computations, and ability to integrate Bash commands to enhance SQL functionality.
- Database Design Expertise: The creation of a student database schema highlights my expertise in designing relational databases, considering data relationships, and ensuring data integrity.
projects.title: SQL Powerhouse: Advanced Querying, Descriptive Statistics, and Database Design in PostgreSQL

member.occupation: PhD in Earth Systems and Geoinformation Sciences

projects.description:
This project leverages geospatial data processing and machine learning techniques to analyze satellite imagery from Maxar Open Data, focusing on the impact of floods in Libya. The project demonstrates effective segmentation of flood-affected areas using the segment-geospatial library and provides valuable insights into the extent of the flooding.

- Data Acquisition and Preparation: Downloaded sample satellite imagery data from Maxar Open Data and installed necessary geospatial libraries such as segment-geospatial and leafmap, etc.
- Interactive Map Creation: Created an interactive map using leafmap with a SATELLITE basemap to visualize the downloaded raster image.
- Satellite Imagery Segmentation: Initialized the SamGeo class for image segmentation and downloaded the necessary model checkpoint. Applied the SamGeo class to segment the raster image, producing a mask, and converted the raster mask to vector format (shapefile).
- Visualization and Analysis: Displayed binary segmentation masks, annotations with random colors for each mask, and compared the original image with the segmentation using a slider. Added the segmented mask and annotation layers to the interactive map for visual exploration.
projects.title: Satellite Imagery Segmentation for Flood Impact Assessment in Libya using Computer Vision
